Name: Ultimate Challenge
Description: At the Research Institute, you encounter two troubled researchers. They seem to be wrestling with a difficult problem…
QuestDesc: At the Research Institute, you encounter two troubled researchers. They seem to be wrestling with a difficult problem…

Dialogues.Speaker: Adele
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So... what do we do?

Dialogues.Speaker: Francine
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You know full well. You will not accept my proposition, nor will I relent.

Dialogues.Speaker: Adele
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then we must resort to the old ways.

Options.PlotLineKey: I gather you two have encountered a difficult problem?

Dialogues.Speaker: Francine
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That is correct. Though in this case, "encountered" is a misnomer, as the problem has long been there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Francine
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Every person has this problem, but most choose to ignore it, or will resort to their base subconscious and emotions, rather than deploying reason…

Dialogues.Speaker: Francine
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But we are researchers. To avoid the problem is tantamount to abandoning rational thought.

Dialogues.Speaker: Francine
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It is the ultimate dilemma a researcher will ever face: Should one grab cat treats from the cafeteria after work... oh no, I mean, should I grab more energy gel?

Dialogues.Speaker: Adele
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But here we are. Have you ever seen researchers crack jokes?

Dialogues.Speaker: Adele
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, delightfully absurd, wouldn't you agree?

Dialogues.Speaker: Adele
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha, you must be thinking, "Have these two gone insane?"

Dialogues.Speaker: Adele
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fear not, we know this problem has little intrinsic value. We only intend to rest our minds by indulging in some meaningless discourse.

Dialogues.Speaker: Francine
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To be precise, when we say "energy gel," we do not mean Instant Wakeup Energy Gel Sachets, but rather the connotative associations of these words.

Dialogues.Speaker: Francine
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To label our discourse as meaningless is a meaningless act itself. Yet if we must assign meaning, energy gel is a term ascribed to "instant processed foods made by modern industry."

Dialogues.Speaker: Francine
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Should we embrace nature and return to slow cooking, which is troublesome but yields tastier food, or should we sacrifice flavor on the altar of convenience and persist in our consumption of energy gel?

Dialogues.Speaker: Francine
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In other words, will we abandon the civilization humanity has built, forsake the pleasures it brings, return to the wilderness, and embrace our true nature?

Dialogues.Speaker: Adele
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ahem, ignore Francine. She has a way of overcomplicating everything.

Dialogues.Speaker: Adele
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Frankly, I think the purpose of life boils down to grabbing something from the cafeteria, be it energy gel or anything else. It doesn't matter.

Dialogues.Speaker: Francine
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't forget researching and dueling, Adele.

Dialogues.Speaker: Adele
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fine, fine. Plus the research job that I most certainly love, along with... Peaks of Prestige.

Dialogues.Speaker: Francine
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Because it's a rare chance to relax when not researching. In a sense, it's also a way to train intelligence and critical thinking.

Dialogues.Speaker: Francine
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The fact that this term appears now is interesting, isn't it? To elevate a mere game alongside important scientific research is a source of delightful absurdity.

Dialogues.Speaker: Adele
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Ahem, enough, Francine. In short, we're duelists too, and strong ones at that.

Dialogues.Speaker: Adele
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We were too busy with research to participate in the regional tournament, but we basically spent all our free time dueling.

Dialogues.Speaker: Adele
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I hear you are also an excellent duelist. Well... How about a match?

Dialogues.Speaker: Francine
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Together as one, Adele.

Dialogues.Speaker: Adele
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's show {Male=him;Female=her} what we're made of, Francine!
